title: Is antibiotic use in livestock above proposed guidelines from antimicrobial resistance researchers?
subtitle: Antibiotic use is measured in milligrams per kilogram of livestock, adjusted to give a population-corrected unit (PCU). Researchers working on antmicrobial resistance have proposed a threshold of 50mg per PCU, which is considered as the proposed threshold here.
sourceDesc: Mulchandani et al. (2023) and Thomas van Boeckel (2017)
